Text:
The Lawless City is, to put it succinctly, one giant
slum—a cesspool where the homeless gather and
shanties line the roads.

But that is not all the city has to offer. There are
three skyscrapers which tower above its streets,
where three rulers reign over its inhabitants.

No kings, knights, or monsters can intervene. This is
a world where only the fittest survive. Where evil,
wealth, and power from all over the globe congregate.
Where might makes right.
Two individuals walk through the city together.

The closer they get to the city's center, the less it
feels like a decrepit slum and the more like a
multicultural hodgepodge.

But the buildings are not the only things that are
different. The people passing by them are no longer
ordinary bums, but ruthless hunters who case them
with gleams in their eyes.
Finally, they reach their destination.
This is it...

Yeah, the Crimson Tower, home to one of the three
rulers of the Lawless City.
The stronghold of vampires...
They brace themselves as they walk.

Quinton and Goldy's appearances make them seem like
complete opposites, but they hit it off surprisingly
well the more they talked.

Maybe it was because they bonded over having been
beaten by the same opponent, but for whatever reason,
the two of them have been working as a team since the
Bushin Festival.

Look. Not even scavengers from the slums dare to step
in here. Get close enough, and it's over. They say
you'll be transformed into a hideous ghoul.
Scared?

Don't be ridiculous! It's just a nest of recluses.
I'm Goldy, the Victorious Golden Dragon—
Hee-hee.
*gasp*

You two aren't qualified enough to pass through this
door...

The only ones qualified are the Blood Queen's
servants, guests, and the strong...
Hahaha.

Gotcha. You got a point. We aren't servants, and we
weren't invited.

But we are strong as hell, and we're here to take
down the Blood Queen!
Hee-hee... Hee-hee-hee-hee!
Whaddaya think you're laughin' at?

I think I'm pretty stupid, but...it's always funny
when I find someone even stupider than me!

The white-haired man sheds his rags, exposing his
body. There's a thick collar with a chain fastened
around his neck and his arm from his right shoulder
down is missing.

The result of my stupidity from when I tried to
challenge the Blood Queen...

Not only did it cost me my arm, but now I'm a lowly
Watchdog on a leash!
Ha! We ain't chumps like you.

Here's a little gift before you die! My power level
is 4,317.5!

Hee-hee... Once, long ago, they used to call me the
White Demon!

The White Demon! You're that high-profile criminal
with a bounty on your head!
But here I'm just a Watchdog!

My only pleasure is cutting up fools like you who
don't know their place!
Hyahahah!
Watch out!
Hah!
Hee-hahaha!
Hyaaah!
(Yup. Just as I expected.)

(The Lawless City really is like some sort of dumping
ground.)
Quit gawking.
Ulp.
It'll be a pain if you catch the eye of some weirdo.
Okey-dokey.
Cid looks up and sees a tower.
Hey.
What?
Aren't we headed for that tower?

Good grief... You want us to just immediately charge
the enemy's stronghold?

We're heading to the Dark Knight Association's base
to first discuss strategy.

The Dark Knight Association... Never seen that back
home.
Well, we have the Knight Order, right?

The Dark Knight Association is a private organization
established for dark knights who are not affiliated
with any public institution. Its role is to handle
matters that the kingdom or lords can't cover—

(As a shadowbroker, the Bushin Festival ended with
satisfactory results.)

(Rose showing up out of nowhere threw me for a bit
of a loop, but thankfully, I was able to improvise a
satisfying climax to my performance.)

(She nearly stole the show from me, but in a flash of
brilliance, I stole it right back from under her
nose.)
(And I totally nailed it.)

(The world is ever changing, and we all have our own
motivations as we walk through life. No performance
goes exactly according to script.)

(So I need to keep my mind pliable to handle any
situation the universe throws at me with a little bit
of improv.)

(Anyway, once the Bushin Festival ended, everything
settled back into its ordinary routine.)

(As for school, little has changed despite Rose's
absence. I hate to say it, but that's the way things
go.)

(Everyone's been saying nasty things about her—that
she acted in a fit of jealousy or that there was some
sort of succession dispute—but nobody knows what
really went down.)

(I'm on her side no matter what her reasons were,
so I hope she's doing okay wherever she is.)

(Oh, and my sister ended up winning the Bushin
Festival.)

(Claire's schedule has supposedly been booked ever
since her victory.)

(Between all the speeches and the parties, she's like
a bona fide celebrity. All that died down a bit when
we headed into fall break, though, and she's back at
the academy now.)

(Unfortunately, now that Claire's free, she's been
breathing down my neck non-stop, and I found myself
reluctantly forced to throw her a celebratory dinner.)

(Thanks to Gamma's connections, we had a free meal—
I mean, a high-class dinner at one of Mitsugoshi's
restaurants, but...)

I had no idea you could pull something like this off.
Not even the party they threw at the castle had food
this nice...
You know, I'm friends with Mitsugoshi's president.
Oh please.

I wish your jokes had better punch lines. Don't
worry, I get what's going on here.

I can see how much work you must have gone through to
put this together for me.

(The two of us continue making small talk as we enjoy
our meal.)
Clear your calendar for fall break.
Wait, what do you mean?
We're going off to the Lawless City to hunt vampires.

(She's wasting no time in training now that the match
is over. I mean, she's my sister and all, but why is
she so bloodthirsty...?)

—What do you think's going to happen to you after you
graduate? With your mediocre grades, you'll have a
hard time getting a decent job.
I mean...

(Now that she mentions it, I haven't given the issue
much thought.)

(She's going to be the head of our household, so I
guess I'm gonna have to get a job of some sort.)

(Something flashy like joining the Knight Order is
out of the question. I need to be someone more
forgettable... Aha!)
I'm gonna become Gatekeeper A.

(You know, an extra who tells the protagonist that he
can't pass until he pays the toll.)
Gatekeeper A? What's "A"?
You know, like, "average"?

For the love of... Gatekeeping is hardly a job fit
for an aristocrat. They work twelve-hour shifts and
get barely any days off. Plus, the work is grueling,
and the pay is dismal.
Oh. Darn...

(Not having any days off sounds miserable. For one,
it'd get in the way of my shadowbroker activities.)
What about jailhouse guards?

That's even worse. You have to interact with the
dregs of society all day.

So I'm gathering you have no goals. Stop making up
excuses on the spot to postpone thinking about what
you want to do with your life.
I brought you here for the sake of your future.
My future?

If you do as I say, I'll be able to wedge you into
the Knight Order after graduation.
Gotcha.

As long as I can do the stuff I want to, I'm fine
working pretty much anywhere.

Stop making up excuses to hide the fact that you're
clueless about what you want to do with your life.

What makes you think that's what I'm doing?
...Well, whatever.
Don't "whatever" me.
You're not "whatever"-ing yourself out of this one...

Hey there, pretty lady! Come have a gander! I just
got some real lively pets in!
